title: Electrostatics - Work to arrange charged spheres

content.description: The figure shows three small-charged spheres arranged in an equilateral triangle with side length <math alttext="0.010 meter" overflow="scroll"> <mn>0.010</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi> </math>. The charges of the spheres are indicated.
content.question: How much work was done on the spheres by external forces to bring them from far away to the configuration shown?

choices.label: <math alttext="6.3 times 10 to the negative six power joule" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>

<math alttext="2.1 times 10 to the negative five power joule" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>

<math alttext="6.3 times 10 to the negative 4 power joule" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>

<math alttext="2.1 times 10 to the negative 3 power joule" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="6.3 times 10 to the negative six power joule" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
